column2: In a medical transaction, 17 times the cost price is equal to 8 times the sum of the cost price and the selling price. What is the gain or loss percentage?
column8:
Shortcut TrickAccording to the question
17 C.P = 8 [C.P + S.P]
9 C.P = 8 S.P
C.P : S.P = 8 : 9 [S.P > C.P; so profit occurs here]
∴ Profit% = [(9 - 8)/8] × 100% = 12.5%

Alternate Method
Given:
17 times the cost price is equal to 8 times the sum of the cost price and the selling price
Formula used:
Gain = SP – CP
Gain% = \(\frac{Gain}{{CP}} × 100\)
Calculation:
17 times the cost price is equal to 8 times the sum of the cost price and the selling price
⇒ 17CP = 8(CP + SP)
⇒ 17CP = 8CP + 8SP
⇒ 17CP – 8CP = 8SP
⇒ 9CP = 8SP
⇒ \(\frac{CP}{{SP}}\) = \(\frac{8}{{9}}\)
Gain = SP – CP
⇒ Gain = (9 – 8) = 1
Gain% = \(\frac{Gain}{{CP}} × 100\)
⇒ Gain% = (\(\frac{1}{{8}}\) × 100)
⇒ 12.5%
∴ The required gain is 12.5%

column2: A<sub>1</sub> and A<sub>2</sub> are two regular polygons. The sum of all the interior angles of A<sub>1</sub> is 1080°. Each interior angle of A<sub>2</sub> exceeds its exterior angle by 132°. The sum of the number of sides A<sub>1</sub> and A<sub>2</sub> is:

⇒ E = 24°
Number of sides of polygon = (360/24)
⇒ 15
So, A2 = 15
Now,

column2: In an examination, the number of students who passed and the number of students who failed were in the ratio 25 ∶ 4. column8:
Given:
Initially Passed : Failed = 25 : 4
Initially Appeared : Failed = 29 : 4
New passed and failed ratio = 22 : 3
New Appeared : Failed = 25 : 3
Concept used:
Total number of students appeared = Pass student + Fail Student
Calculation:
Let Initially the number of students who passed and failed the examination be 25x and 4x
Total number of student appeared = 25x + 4x = 29x
According to the question,
Total Student / Number of students failed
(29x + 1)/(4x - 3) = 25/3
⇒ 3(29x + 1) = 25(4x - 3)
⇒ 87x + 3 = 100x - 75
⇒ 13x = 78
⇒ x = 6
So,
Difference = 25x - 4x = 21x
Actual = 21 × 6 = 126
∴ The required difference is 126.

So

\(\frac{25x + 4}{4x -3} = \frac{22}{3}\)
⇒ 75x + 12 = 88x - 66
⇒ 13x = 78
⇒ x = 6
Difference between the number of students who, initially, passed the examination and the number of students who failed the examination = 25x - 4x = 21x = 21 × 6 = 126

column2: If x<sup>4</sup> + y<sup>4</sup> + x<sup>2</sup>y<sup>2</sup> = \(17\frac{1}{16}\) and x<sup>2</sup> – xy + y<sup>2</sup> = \(5\frac{1}{4}\), then one of the values of (x – y) is:

xy = -1 ----(v)
Now, Using the formula (a - b)2= a2 + b2 - 2ab
(x - y)2= x2 + y2 - 2xy
From (iv) and (v), we get
⇒ (x - y)2= (17/4) - 2 × (-1)

⇒ (x - y) = 5/2.

column2: Two pillars A and B of the same height are on opposite sides of a road which is 40 m wide. ⇒ h = 40/(√3 + 1)

⇒ QO = (40√3)/(√3 + 1)

⇒ QO = 20(3 - √3) m

column2: A lady sold an article for Rs. 960 at some profit. Had she sold it for Rs. 800, then there would have been a loss equal to \(\frac{1}{3}\) of the initial profit. What was the profit percentage of the article?

⇒ x = 840
